result.execSummary:
The defendant Nikolai William Jirikowic was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nikolai William Jirikowic is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nikolai William Jirikowic was found guilty of Disorderly conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution of $611.00 has been paid to the DA's office as of this date and part of this plea agreement. Def shall pay the 10% ($61.10)  to the DA within 60 days

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
11:10 AM Defendant Nikolai William Jirikowic appeared by phone.  Attorney Steven Daniel Johnson appeared by phone for Nikolai William Jirikowic.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Def has completed volunteer time, 50 hours, this case is resolved. State moves to amend to forfeiture, DC. Def has paid his portion of the restitution, $611.00, just needs to pay the 10% yet to victim witness, $61.10. Court gives def 60 days to pay the $61.10 to VW office. 950/Marsy's Law complied with. NC plea entered Count 2, Dismissed Count 1.

Letter of Completion for Volunteer Time

Letter of Completion for Volunteer Time

3:12 PM Defendant Nikolai William Jirikowic appeared by phone.  Attorney Steven Daniel Johnson appeared by phone for Nikolai William Jirikowic.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights efiled along with restitution request. Defendant waives right to in person appearance. State is in compliance w/victim's rights. Court does plea colloquy w/defendant. Defendant was unsure what he was to plead to count 1 and requests to speak with his attorney. Court adjourns to allow attorney to speak with defendant. Court informs the parties that he would be more comfortable with the agreement if restitution was paid prior to plea. Defense requests 30 days.
